results.title: Content Manager
results.description:
Social Discovery Group is one of the world's largest groups of social discovery companies, which includes more than 40 different brands, an investment fund, and a venture studio.
We solve the problems of loneliness, isolation, and separation of people with the help of digital reality. Our products include both international dating sites operated by our subsidiary Dating Group and new social and entertainment apps created by SDG Lab. More than 180 million people in 100 different countries use the technologies we develop, and we aim to reach ten times that number.
Our team consists of more than 700 professionals and digital nomads who can work from any country in the world. Together, we develop services based on new communication principles, focusing on live video broadcasts, AI technologies, and game mechanics.

Currently, we have an opening for a Content Manager to join our team.

We expect from you:

  • English - C2 or native speaker;
  • Experience in data markup;
  • Experience in compiling datasets for training models.

Your tasks will be:

  • Labeling text data;
  • Compiling new datasets (text);
  • Editing datasets (text);
  • Testing labeled data.

We are happy to offer:

  • Work in the international team. We have employees from the US, UK, Cyprus, China, Colombia, and other countries in 11 offices around the world;
  • Health insurance;
  • 7 wellness days / 7 extra paid days off that can be used to solve everyday issues, lie down and recover without sick leave or just relax;
  • Participation in international conferences and professional trainings;
  • Corporate discount for English classes, participation in sports events, a running club, and yoga online;
  • Own line of branded clothes and accessories with corporate symbols for various occasions (Welcome Pack when joining our team, a gift after probation, for professional holidays and corporate parties);
  • Internal gamified gratitude system: receive bonuses from colleagues and exchange them for days off, merch, team buildings, massage certificates, etc.

results.title: Senior Security Engineer
results.description:
About You

You’re a software engineer with a deep security background, who loves autonomy and self-direction. You have experience coding in a variety of languages, as well as setting up SIEMs and other systems to monitor security-related events. You enjoy collaborating with others as well as working independently to accomplish your goals.

About the Job

You’ll join the distributed Constructor security team, which is responsible for both corporate and infrastructure security. You’ll be working with our CISO, our devops team, and our software engineers to create systems to monitor and improve security, help other engineers effectively write secure code, and test our systems to ensure they’re secure.

This role will have a large say in determining security priorities and enhancing Constructor’s security posture.

Requirements

Your specific responsibilities will include:

  • Writing code (in Python, Ruby, and Javascript) to add and improve security features in our codebases
  • Working with other engineers to review code for vulnerabilities
  • Reviewing and improving our production security architecture
  • Performing regular pen tests and scans
  • Running periodic mock incident response sessions
  • Responding to security incidents

Requirements

You will be successful in this role if you're described by some of the below:

  • Have at least 5 years of experience working as a security professional
  • Have experience working with many programming languages, including Python, Ruby, and Javascript
  • Have experience setting up and maintaining security platforms, SIEMs, and monitoring systems
  • Have worked at a high-traffic website with highly available and robust systems
  • Pick up new ideas and technologies quickly, love learning and talking to others about them
  • Enjoy helping others around you
  • Can work independently

Benefits


  • Unlimited vacation time -we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year
  • A competitive compensation package including stock options
  • Company sponsored US health coverage (100% paid for employee)
  • Fully remote team - choose where you live
  • Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office
  • Apple laptops provided for new employees
  • Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year
  • Maternity & Paternity leave for qualified employees
  • Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact

    • Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor

    At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group.

results.title: Associate Consultant
results.description:
Company Description

Leapgen is a global digital transformation company shaping the Now of Work. We partner with enterprise leaders to better design and deliver workforce services and architect HR technology solutions that meet the expectations of workers and the needs of the business. Our areas of focus include HR Technology, HR Operations and Service Delivery, and Workforce Experience. Leapgen is founded on the core values of Love, Energy, Audacity and Proof. That means we:

  • LOVE what we do, which

  • ENERGIZES us and our clients to do

  • AUDACIOUS things, and

  • PROVE our success - early and often!

We’re smart, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We’re passionate about improving workforce experience and positioning HR to better serve people while acting as a strategic partner to the business. We think differently: transformation is constant, disruption should be healthy and strategic, and people and business are meant to be agile. As such, we encourage and expect our people to be innovative, to do different things. We challenge ourselves to stretch, adapt, learn and improve...constantly. Our customers will tell you we feel like a valued extension of their team because we are.



Job Description

The Associate Consultant is a fantastic opportunity for a self-starter who is eager to learn and work collaboratively with experienced consultants who are responsible for infusing our clients with strategic principles and practices and revolutionizing how the HR function fosters a positive workforce experience. A successful Associate Consultant is one who is happy being exposed to a number of disciplines (e.g., design thinking, HR tech strategy, service delivery modeling, requirements definition, software evaluation) through their support of our customers and experts on the Leapgen team. Your analytical, interpersonal, creative thinking, business management and leadership skills will be called upon from day one. You will begin by learning what we do and how we do it and then be placed on interesting and challenging projects, as you work side by side with some of the best in the business.

The Day-to-Day Stuff:

  • Gather and analyze information through both primary and secondary research (e.g., on industry practices, on HR and workforce technology providers); these efforts may be tied to a discrete consulting project or customer question submitted through our subscription-based advisory service

  • Support consulting teams doing both strategy work and deployment work by documenting meeting notes, helping build exercises for workshops, building and analyzing surveys, pulling together material and drafting and/or copyediting deliverables (e.g., findings, analyses, recommendations, process maps)

  • Assess team output with a strong attention to detail to ensure all deliverables are client ready (e.g., consistent, accurate, correct) 

  • Participate in workforce design efforts using Human Centered Design methodology

  • Support lead consultants in creating change enablement strategies and plans

  • Contribute to the development of delivery tools and resources

  • Provide proactive, timely updates to your Engagement Manager on your assigned activities, noting any risks or issues and thoughts on how to best mitigate them.

  • Foster client relationships that are strong and lasting

  • Proactively keep yourself abreast of Digital Transformation trends, seek out opportunities to further your skills and professional growth



Qualifications

This Should Describe You:

Must-Haves 

  • Passionate about solving problems

  • Minimum 2 years work experience, ideally as an HR Practitioner (e.g., associate, system analyst) or associate management consultant focused on HR work

  • Strong interpersonal skills, customer-centric attitude

  • Strong communication skills (both written and verbal), including ability to effectively manage customer expectations

  • Team player and consensus builder

  • Can collaborate with multiple clients simultaneously, work with remote teams, think creatively, manage own time and take initiative to drive projects

  • Basic understanding of cloud concepts and technologies 

  • Proficiency with Google Apps

Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree, ideally in an HR or IT discipline preferred

  • Experience or knowledge of Design Thinking principles and practices a plus



Additional Information

Type

  • Permanent Full-time Employment

Location and Travel

  • Remote (continental US and Canada). 

  • Travel ~30%

How to get started: If you’re excited by the idea of seeing yourself in this role at Leapgen, please apply with your CV and a cover letter that best expresses your interest and unique qualifications. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Leapgen makes an oath to protect people in the workplace. We are committed to reducing conscious and unconscious bias and fostering a judgement-free workplace that celebrates diversity. Here are a few ways we put this into action:

  • We want you to shine through a great interview experience. When we reach out to schedule a conversation, we’ll ask whether you require any accommodation to make that so.

  • We don’t seek culture fit; rather, we seek and welcome diverse ideas and perspectives that can enhance our culture, showcase new perspectives, and challenge our thinking. You can be you here.

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
About the Business Analyst position

We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst who assist in improving the communication between our information technology capacity and our business objectives. Your duties will include supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product's features.

You should have good understanding of business processes as well as principles of technical teams' work. We also expect you to have good analytical capabilities and to be a result-driven team player.

 

Business Analyst responsibilities are:

  • Build and maintain relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration

  • Develop configuration specifications and business analysis requirements

  • Perform quality assurance and define reporting and alerting requirements

  • Participate in designing, documenting and maintaining of system processes

  • Explore on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team

  • Interact with the product team to share key insights and findings

  • Search for ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer

 

Business Analyst requirements are:

  • 3+ years' experience of working on a Business / Systems Analyst or Quality Assurance Engineer position

  • Significant experience in eliciting requirements and testing

  • Significant experience in analysing data to draw business-relevant conclusions

  • Good knowledge of data visualization techniques and tools

  • Familiarity with SQL queries and generating process documentation

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

  • A degree in IT or Computer Science

Not everything applies to you? No problem, apply anyway.

results.title: Customer Support Engineer
results.description:
CIQ OVERVIEW

CIQ believes in helping people do great things.  We do this by building strong communities for open-source software, innovating software infrastructure, and building the next generation of performance computing.  Our software stack consists of Rocky Linux the CentOS replacement, Apptainer the container solution of choice for HPC, Warewulf a provisioning and cluster management solution, and Fuzzball our next-generation performance computing platform that is a multi-cloud, multi-site, multi-cluster, and multi-node.

If you are interested in an environment built on ownership, diversity of thought, and pushing the limits of what is possible, then we would be interested in you.

 

POSITION SUMMARY

We are looking for a dedicated Tier 3 Customer Support Engineer that is responsible for resolving the most complex issues and ensuring that our customers' technical queries are resolved in a timely and satisfactory manner. In this role, your duties will include assisting customers with product installations, resolving queries via Jira, and escalating serious issues to the engineering team. The individual should exhibit quality oversight and work with the support management as well as other departments that are critical to the team's success. Additional responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Providing customers with world-class support to worldwide clients.

  • Working directly with engineering to troubleshoot and track issues for bug fixes.

  • Troubleshooting support issues by asking customers targeted questions.

  • Providing customers with step-by-step guidance to resolve technical problems.

  • Following up on technical queries and providing prompt feedback.

  • Prioritizing customer queries and escalating serious technical issues to engineering.

  • Documenting error reports and monitoring performance metrics.

  • Relaying product functionality feedback from customers to engineering.

  • Creating product documentation and useful KB articles.

  • Providing mentorship and training to new staff members in the organization.

NEEDED TO SUCCEED

Successful candidates will have interest and experience in Linux-based operating systems services. In-depth knowledge of cloud space administration such as Google GCP, AWS, Azure, and Oracle OCI. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and debugging abilities with experience using debugging tools such as strace, perf, and SOS reports. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Flexibility to work different shifts to provide world-class support. Available shifts include 8:00am-5:00pm and 4:00pm-1:00am. The ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a remote team environment. A friendly, collaborative, humble, honest, and always striving to be better attitude.

 

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
At least 5 years experience as a Customer Support Engineer or similar experience. At least 5 years of Linux OS administration and engineering on CentOS or RHEL. A proven track record of technical support with proficiency in remote desktop and helpdesk software (Jira Service Desk).

 

BENEFITS

  • Medical, dental, vision insurance (80% employer/20% employee)

  • Flexible paid time off

  • Employee stock options

  • Remote work, no required travel for most positions.

results.title: Presales Solution Architect - Cloud Services
results.description:
We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for a Presales Solution Architect - Cloud Services.

Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud.

Your daily work:

  • Understanding the customer's IT landscape, you will be analyzing the customer's requirements and designing architectural solutions during the presales solutioning phase
  • Your tasks include PoCs, architectural design sessions, implementation projects, IT portfolio transformation plans, deployment guidance as well as workshops
  • Furthermore, you will help our project managers and cloud engineers to understand the customers' needs and you will help our sales team identify sales blockers and create offers
  • You will also contribute to consulting projects by working together with our Cloud Advisors on customer projects, for example in planning cloud business cases, defining cloud strategies, or delivering operating models

Your skills and attributes of success:

  • Several years of professional experience in a similar role, e.g. as a Cloud Architect, PreSales Architect, etc.
  • Understanding of the presales solutioning process (for example deal qualification, solutioning, sales to delivery handover)
  • Expertise in the public cloud (AWS or Azure or GCP) and DevOps technologies
  • Multiple years of experience in Application Design, Architecture, and Implementation
  • Experience in at least one of these areas: Systems Operations /Systems Management, Networking, IT Security, and IT Governance 
  • Travel Willingness up to 25%
  • Fluent communication skills in English; German is a plus

If you don't meet all of the desired criteria, but still fit most of the requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Let's find out together if we are a good fit for each other!

What do we offer in return?

  • A highly skilled multinational team
  • Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, GCP) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
  • Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
  • Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
  • Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Germany
  • Local benefits such as 30 days holiday allowance, pension allowance, Qualitrain card, and many more

Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Germany.

Learn more about #NordcloudCommunity. If you'd like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.

About Nordcloud 

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It's a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner's Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and it has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects.

Learn more at nordcloud.com

results.title: Research and Data Analyst - SMB
results.description:
Company Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative for consumers under the Forbes Marketplace umbrella that provides journalist- and expert-written insights, news and reviews on all things personal finance.

We’re dedicated to helping turn aspirations into reality. We do this by providing consumers with the knowledge and research they need to make informed financial decisions they can feel confident in, so they can get back to doing the things they care about most.



Job Description

Forbes Advisor is a new initiative under the Marketplace umbrella that provides consumers with journalist- and expert-written insights, news, and reviews on all things personal finance. Our goal is to help small and medium businesses (SMBs) make informed decisions by providing them with the knowledge and research they need.

We are seeking an SMB Data Analyst to join our team and assist our editorial team in creating top-quality content. In this role, you will provide competitive analysis on the market and ensure the quality and accuracy of data collection and analysis for products and services relevant to SMBs, with a focus on software. Your research and analysis will be a key component of making trustworthy, relevant assessments of products and services, and will help thousands of SMBs make informed decisions about the products and services they use.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting opportunity similar to those found at a start-up, with the benefits of a seasoned and successful company, then this may be the role for you.

Responsibilities:

  • Review editorial data requests for feasibility, usability, and scalability
  • Leverage a team of freelancers to collect product and service data, with a focus on products for SMBs
  • Perform analysis on collected data to identify top-quality products and services for SMBs
  • Develop and implement processes for quality control
  • Collaborate with peers to introduce and develop new techniques and processes for efficient data collection
  • Collaborate with the editorial team to ensure deadlines and goals are met
  • Review editorial content resulting from work product for accuracy and completeness

About You:

  • Highly organized, with strong attention to detail and critical thinking abilities
  • Comfortable working in G-Suite, with an emphasis on Google Sheets
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment and prioritize projects accordingly
  • Previous experience in a quality role is preferred
  • Comfortable managing your own projects and deliverables

Qualifications:

  • Associates Degree or Certificate in a relevant field, such as business or computer science, or equivalent training and experience
  • Proficiency in using Google Sheets for data analysis and manipulation
  • Proven experience in software testing, as well as proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation are desirable

Benefits:

  • We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, unlimited PTO, disability coverage, employee assistance program, and a paid parental leave program.



Qualifications



Additional Information

Forbes Marketplace provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

results.title: Senior Front End Developer
results.description:
Who is Sharesource?

We are a social enterprise that exists to bring global opportunities closer to smart individuals. We want companies to be able to successfully grow their business by accessing the talent they need to fuel that growth, wherever they may be in the world. We want people to find success in their career and be part of a company that they can be proud of.

Each and everyone of our employees is an ambassador of Sharesource. We are committed to carry out, live out, and communicate our values and culture as a company. We hope to create a positive impact in every way imaginable.

https://www.sharesource.com.au/

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a super smart and passionate Front End Developer or Full Stack Developer who is motivated to come and help us build the experience our customers will see and feel. This person should be a self-starter, creative thinker, proactive and enthusiastic. Someone who is focused on continuous improvement, constantly seeking to learn new things and willing to contribute to a collaborative environment will be highly successful in this role.

What are you expected to do?

  • Design and build responsive web applications, forms and components using the latest JavaScript frameworks such as React
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, estimate, design, and deliver new 
  • features.
  • Follow secure and best practice coding standards and continuous integration processes.
  • Design and write high quality code and valuable automated unit tests integrated with CI/CD pipeline.
  • Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement improvements to maximise development efficiency.

What's cool about this job?

  • Be part of a company building a sophisticated platform and get to work on exciting and challenging projects
  • You get to work with really fun, creative and passionate individuals who will not just help you grow your career but they will also make it a lot more enjoyable for you.
  • You will develop your expertise using modern technologies and software development processes

You'll be a great fit if you have:

  • At least 5 years of experience in software development experience with strong competency as a front end developer
  • React JS development, experience with both class and functional components, Redux. Preference for Hooks a plus.
  • Experience developing web pages using CSS, HTML/HTML5
  • Proven eye for delivering polished UX and UI design
  • Experience using version control, specifically Git
  • Experience using UI libraries (Semantic UI or Material UI)
  • Experience with TypeScript (or other typing alternatives)
  • Excellent communication skills

We will be absolutely thrilled if you also have the following:

  • Experience with Unit testing frameworks and tools (jest, Storybook, react-testing-library)
  • Integrating with REST API's (Django)
  • Producing design artefacts (e.g. screen mock-ups)
  • Experience with interface design tools such as Figma
  • Exposure to DevOps including experience with AWS
  • Experience with end to end testing
  • CI/CD using GitLab, including adding automation around the CI/CD processes
  • Experience using Docker
  • Experience with Python

What you get from joining us:

  • Above market salary
  • HMO coverage plus 1 free dependent
  • Monthly personal coaching and regular training events
  • Cool and interesting clients to work with
  • Warm and friendly working environment
  • Be empowered to be a leader or an expert in your field
  • Flexibility to work from home

You will feel at home at Sharesource if you are: 

  1. A driver of his/her own education, into self-improvement - reads books, listens to podcasts, subscribes to articles, with a goal in mind to create value for oneself and for others, asks for feedback from his/her head for improvement points
  2. With a curious mind
  3. Has the ability to identify problems, come up with options, and recommend the way forward
  4. Into process improvements - thinks of making processes more effective, streamlines processes, into working smarter
  5. Ready to roll your sleeves up to help get things done
  6. With an Attitude of Gratitude
  7. Self-leader, a fire starter

Your Recruitment Journey:

  1. The whole process takes about 2-4 weeks.
  2. There will be 3-4 interviews and a possible technical test from our client. You will undergo an initial interview, interview with our lovely clients. This will run for about 1-2 weeks but we will let you know if we need to ramp it up. Be yourself and have fun. 
  3. We will constantly communicate with you as to the development of your application. You can also directly communicate with us to ask us about the status of your application.
  4. If all goes well, we will ask you to complete the reference check and provide other necessary requirements so we can offer you the job right away

At Sharesource, we believe that the uniqueness of each and every individual adds huge value to any organisation. As a social enterprise, we are committed to building a global organisation that attracts and leverages diversity in our team, and strives for respect and inclusion throughout our workplace and in the communities we serve. 

We hire without any bias towards race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

results.title: Full-Stack Developer
results.description:
Are you a high-performing, full-stack developer looking to be part of a fast-growing edtech startup? Are you passionate about using your skills to make a positive impact in the lives of young people? If so, Youthfully may be the perfect fit for you!

Youthfully is a revolutionary 1:1 youth coaching platform that connects young people with experienced coaches who are dedicated to helping them reach their full potential. We are hiring for an experienced Full-Stack Developer to help us build the most innovative platform in the education sector. This is a remote and full-time position.

As a full-stack developer at Youthfully, you will work alongside the CTO/Co-founder and be responsible for designing and developing scalable, maintainable microservices integrated into modern platform UI components.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and develop scalable and maintainable microservices using languages and frameworks such as Node.js, Python, and Go.
  • Implement RESTful APIs and use message-based communication patterns to enable communication between microservices.
  • Write clean and maintainable code using best practices such as code review, continuous integration, and delivery.
  • Develop and maintain the front-end of the modern platform using technologies such as React, NextJs, and MUI.
  • Implement responsive and mobile-friendly user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Collaborate with the team to define and document microservices architecture and design patterns.

 

Requirements:

  • 7+ years overall software development experience.
  • 4+ years of experience with microservices architecture and design patterns, including experience with languages and frameworks such as Node.js, Python, and Go.
  • 4+ years of experience in React and experience with the full web development stack, including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Experience with responsive and mobile-friendly design principles.

 

Additional Qualifications:

  • Experience using AUTH technologies such as OAuth2
  • A solid foundation and expertise in developing microservices on top of serverless infra are essential.
  • Experience working with 3rd party services like Stripe, mailing, and conversation services is a plus.
  • Experience with version control systems such as Git and with agile development methodologies.
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS and Google cloud.
  • Knowledge and Experience working with Infra as a code.

 

About the Company:

Youthfully is a leading education startup passionate about using technology to make a positive impact in the lives of young people. We believe that every young person has the power to make positive changes in their lives and achieve their goals, and our platform is designed to provide them with the support, guidance, and accountability they need to succeed. Our team is dedicated, supportive, and passionate about what we do, and we are always looking for new ways to improve and innovate.

results.title: Graphic/Brand Designer
results.description:
About You

You’re a passionate and strategic graphic designer with experience designing a company’s visual identity and translating it into high-performing marketing assets.


About Us

Constructor powers product search and discovery for some of the largest retailers in the world, like Sephora and Backcountry. We serve billions of requests every year, and you’ve probably seen our results somewhere and used our product without knowing it.

We differentiate ourselves by focusing on metrics over features, and reinventing search and discovery from the ground up as a machine learning challenge with the specific goal of improving metrics like revenue. We have grown several hundred percent YoY for the last 2 years and have customers in every eCommerce vertical, around the world, and spanning many languages.

We’re a passionate team of technologists who love solving problems and want to make our customers’ and coworkers’ lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they think is best can lead to great things.


About the Job

This role will reside within the marketing org and will be responsible for designing the majority of our visual marketing collateral and assets. Reporting to the Head of Content Marketing, you will partner closely with marketing leadership to develop Constructor’s strategic brand identity, creating overall style guidelines as well as website wireframes, social and blog graphics, and display ads.

Ideal candidates will have experience in page layout, brand identity, and graphic design, with working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite. Experience in Hubspot, Figma, and/or WordPress (Elementor) and knowledge of HTML/CSS are a plus, but not required.

Passion for doing great work, attention to detail, and interest in learning about our product and audience are a must. Bonus for experience in B2B marketing and tech; we are looking for a skilled, experienced designer who understands the role of visual identity and can problem solve when it comes to explaining complex concepts with thoughtful visuals.


Responsibilities include:

  • Owning Constructor’s creative visual identity and ensuring it’s applied consistently
  • Evaluating content strategically to determine graphic needs
  • Designing optimized graphics for web, social, and paid media
  • Designing and updating slide decks for sales enablement
  • Designing and laying out ebooks and whitepapers
  • Wireframing site pages


Benefits

  • Unlimited vacation time -we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year
  • A competitive compensation package including stock options
  • Company sponsored US health coverage (100% paid for employee)
  • Fully remote team - choose where you live
  • Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office
  • Apple laptops provided for new employees
  • Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year
  • Maternity & Paternity leave for qualified employees
  • Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor

At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group.

results.title: Technical Recruiter
results.description:
This is a remote permanent employment role for people based in Canada (ET or CT Time Zones).

 

The Opportunity 

Growing and dynamic organizations are fueled and driven by passionate and intellectually curious people. We’re looking to add more NearFormers who fit this profile. At NearForm we are in the fortunate position of having 10 years of experience delivering on mission critical outcomes for our customers, while still retaining the start-up feel, transparency, and intimacy of a close knit community of technologists.   

We build digital products that provide users of these products fantastic digital experiences and allow enterprises to go to market faster, improve customer experience, while transforming their workflows and advancing our clients’ digital agendas. With a recent significant investment into the business, NearForm is poised to scale its impact to more enterprises. 

Are you the right person to fuel this growth and add to a wonderfully collaborative culture?  

The Role

We are scaling at a very fast pace and the Talent team is the engine at the centre of our growth plans. We are an experienced team with a good understanding of how to hire great Engineering talent while being open to fresh ideas and perspectives - we like to foster a culture of continuous improvement in everything we do.

We’re looking for a hands on Technical Recruiter in Canada to help our expansion plans.  This will be an individual contributor role as a member of a very collaborative team.

Key Requirements

Our Ideal Candidate:

  • Self starter who can work proactively and autonomously
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Comfortable working in a remote-first culture
  • Provide an add to our culture; bringing energy, empathy, and fun to work daily
  • Ability to work across multiple roles and streams
  • A good networker with demonstrable experience building long term relationships with candidates
  • Strong stakeholder management skills and a consultative approach

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Sourcing and attracting candidates
  • Manage the full recruitment life cycle with an emphasis on great candidate experience
  • Collaborate with internal teams to develop sourcing and attraction strategies to drive top talent to NearForm
  • Identify recruitment market trends and tools

Experience Guidelines:

  • You should be comfortable working in a fast paced environment
  • You should have experience hiring software engineering roles and know what good looks like
  • Familiarity using Sourcing tools and applicant tracking systems to manage active and passive candidate pools

Benefits

  • Employee Benefits
  • Work remotely; we have a genuine dedication to work/life balance. 
  • Work flexibly; we appreciate there are more important things in life than work so our flexible working culture allows you to work around what matters - school run, no problem!
  • The Wellness Hub: We have a genuine commitment to fostering/improving NearFormers’ wellbeing.

Although we are widely dispersed, NearFormers are a tightly-knit team. We trust one another and care about our colleagues. Building on our open-source origins, we promote the sharing of thoughts, knowledge and ideas.

results.title: Commercial Counsel
results.description:
Description

Claroty empowers the world's largest enterprises to secure their cyber-physical systems across industrial (OT), healthcare (IoMT), and enterprise (IoT) environments: the Extended Internet of Things (IoT). The Claroty Platform integrates with customers’ existing infrastructure to provide a full range of controls for visibility, risk and vulnerability management, threat detection, and secure remote access. Our platform is deployed by hundreds of organizations at thousands of sites across all seven continents, and our customers represent critical national infrastructure across the healthcare, oil & gas, utilities, mining, and manufacturing verticals. 

Founded in 2015, Claroty is headquartered in New York City, with more than 400 employees across the Americas, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and Tel Aviv. Claroty has raised $635 million in funding from the world’s largest investment firms and industrial automation vendors – including SoftBank, Bessemer Venture Partners, Rockwell Automation, Schneider Electric, and Siemens – making it the most well-funded industrial cybersecurity company. 

Claroty is a dynamic, fast-growing company, and we live our values of People First, Customer Obsession, Strive for Excellence, and Integrity. We are always searching for energetic people who will get excited about these values and make a difference.

We are looking for an exceptionally gifted Commercial Counsel to join our growing team of the most outstanding and creative minds in cybersecurity.  

The position is remote and relevant for UK or Ireland-based candidates.



Responsibilities:

In this role you will, among other things

(i) draft and negotiate all types of agreements between the Company and its customers, partners and vendors;

(ii) ensure compliance with various regulatory and employment law matters, including privacy matters;

(iii) handle various corporate matters related to the Company’s subsidiaries in Europe;

(iv) work and coordinate with local and/or outside counsel as necessary.

 



Region:
Europe

Requirements
  • A qualified lawyer authorized to practice in the UK or Ireland with a Bachelor of Laws degree or equivalent and at least 3-6 years of experience working as a commercial lawyer in a leading law firm and/or in-house legal department.
  • Significant experience negotiating various commercial transactions worldwide, with a focus on SaaS and other licensing agreements, partner agreements, and general purchasing matters.
  • Familiarity with privacy law issues, including GDPR.
  • Excellent drafting and conversational skills.
  • Ability to balance legal concerns with requirements of business.
  • Ability to work under pressure.
  • Availability outside normal business hours.
  • Highly motivated team player, with attention to detail and problem-solving attitude.
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
  • Familiarity with laws in EU is a plus.
  • Ability to work in German and/or French is a plus.

 

Claroty is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment for all. We encourage applications from candidates of all diverse backgrounds.
